column5: Have fished Machawain and Kenozha with Ernie and Donna several times over the last 10 years, but have not been since 2007. Looking to plan another trip to one of their lakes, Peninsular, and looking for any reviews. @Novtroy - any chance you have been to Peninsular?
Looking into a trip with TFO out of Armstrong. Does anyone have experience with this outfitter, in particular their camps north of the Albany River? Thanks

Went to Machawaian in 1998 and Kenosha in 2000 - both times in late Aug./early Sept. Had a good experience both times. Good cabin, boats, motors, etc. Spent most of our efforts on walleye. Bad day 20-30 per man, Good day 70+ per man. More good days than bad. Most 2-4 lbs. A few 6-8 for the week. Can't comment on the Pike fishing. Have heard good things about Keezik, but opennings/dates have never worked right for us. Will definitely go back sometime. Let me know if I can be of more specific help. Crede
Is there a website for Trophy Fish Outpost
Thanks, Crede. We, too will be targeting walleye in Sept. Did you try the portage lakes?
Didn't try the portage lakes. Did boat into the next lake down from Kenozha and had a good day there. Crede

have been to all of their camps several times.fishing,service,boats,motors,cabins-all were great.camps are now owned by huron air.they will take good care of you.machawain was great as was portage lake,maracle.keezhik is huge and we found fish everywhere.kenozhe is smaller but still great fishing-we went downstream about 5 rapids -fishing good all the way including an unexpected 5 pound brooktrout.any other questions-let me know..tim
Thanks, Tim and Crede, I'll have some more questions for you in the near future.

Have been fishing with Ernie and Donna for 20 years. They are the best outfitters I have used. Camp and boats are well taken care of. They used to outfit many camps but have limited the the number of outposts
